text: Kiko mi por hasi despues ku un partisipante divulgá abuso, negligensia òf eksplotashon?

SourceText: How should I report abuse?
text: Kon mi mester reportá abuso?

SourceText: Crisis Hotlines
text: Liña di Sosten pa Kaso di Krísis

SourceText: Next:
text: Siguiente:

SourceText: 1️⃣ I didn’t have enough time
text: 1️⃣ Mi no tabatin sufisiente tempu

SourceText:
It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. 

✨Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together. 

Use the time that you and your girls and boys are already sharing, like going to the school, picking up them, waking them up or say good by for sleeping. 

You can even make household chores into a game to do together.
text:
E por ta difísil pa haña tempu durante bo dia, ku trabou, tareanan i tur otro kos. 

✨Pensa riba un tempu kada dia ku bo por saka 5 minüt. Bo por asta hasi trabounan di kas un wega pa hasi huntu. 

Usa e tempu ku abo i bo yu muhé i yu hòmber ta kompartí kaba, manera bai skol, buska nan, lanta nan òf bisa nan bonochi promé ku bai drumi. 

Bo por asta hasi trabounan di kas un wega pa hasi huntu.

SourceText: 2️⃣ My child did not want to spend time with me
text: 2️⃣ Mi yu no tabata ke pasa tempu ku mi

SourceText:
😔 It can hurt when your child does not want to spend 1-on- time with you. 

💡 Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?

💙 Try again so that your child can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
text:
😔 E por hasi doló ora bo yu no ke pasa tempu huntu ku bo. 

💡 Pensa pa bo mes: Ki ora nan ta mas habrí pa bo? Den oranan di mainta? Djis promé ku bai drumi?

💙 Purba atrobe pa bo yu por mira ku bo ta preokupá p'e i ke pasa e tempu akí kuné.

SourceText: 3️⃣ All my child wanted to do was watch TV or play with a gadget
text: 3️⃣ Tur loke mi yu tabata ke hasi tabata wak televishon òf hunga ku un aparato

SourceText:
📺Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget.

❓ You could watch or play on the gadget with them.

💚Caring about their interests is a great start!

🌷 Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.
text:
📺Muchanan hopi biaha ke pasa tempu wak televishon of hunga ku un aparato.

❓ Bo por wak òf hunga riba e aparato ku nan.

💚Mustra interes pa nan interesnan ta un bon komienso!

🌷 Unabes boso kuminsá pasa tempu huntu bo por sugeri un otro aktividat.

SourceText: 4️⃣ My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about
text: 4️⃣ Mi yu tabata ke hasi kosnan ku mi tabata sinti mi inkómodo kuné

SourceText:
☀️ If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.

🏁If they are younger, you could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.You can also express enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or offering a thumbs-up. 

💛 Praise them while they do it!

📱 Sometimes older children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. 

🚩 Explain *why* you can't do them, and suggest a different activity.
text:
☀️ Si bo yu ke hasi kosnan ku ta muchu difísil pa bo hasi, bo por djis wak nan.

🏁Si nan ta mas yòn, bo por deskribí kiko nan ta hasiendo manera un lokutor di deporte. Bo por ekspresá entusiasmo tambe dor di bati man, smail òf saka un dùim ariba. 

💛 Elogiá nan miéntras nan ta hasié!

📱 Tin bia muchanan mas grandi lo sugerí aktividatnan ku ta violento òf no mashá seif. 

🚩 Splika *dikon* bo no por hasi nan i sugerí un aktividat diferente.

SourceText:
😣 Sharing emotions can be hard. It’s even harder when they are strong emotions!

💚 Help your teen know that you are open and willing to listen when they are ready.

👂 Remember, the most important part is just to listen to them.
text:
😣 Kompartí emoshon por ta difísil. Ta asta mas difísil ora nan ta emoshonnan fuerte!

💚 Yuda bo yu tiner sa ku bo ta habrí i dispuesto pa skucha ora e ta kla.

👂 Kòrda, e parti mas importante ta djis pa skucha nan.

SourceText: 2️⃣ I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
text: 2️⃣ Mi a sinti mi inkómodo papiando di mi sintimentunan

SourceText:
▶️ Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. 

⏰ Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving a good example by noticing and sharing your emotions. 

💚 Over time, your teen will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.
text:
▶️ Kuminsá un kos nobo semper ta difísil na kuminsamentu. 

⏰ Duna boso mes algun tempu pa kustumá ku esaki i sigui duna un bon ehempel dor di nota i kompartí boso emoshonnan.

💚 Ku tempu, bo tiner lo siña hasi meskos – i e lo sinti su mes mas stimá i kuidá.

SourceText: 3️⃣ I was afraid my child might think I am weak for sharing my own emotions.
text: 3️⃣ Mi tabatin miedu ku mi yu por a pensa ku mi ta débil pa kompartí mi mes emoshonnan.

SourceText:
💛 Sharing your emotions sets an important example for your teen - even more when sharing difficult emotions! 

🌷 It makes everyone in the family stronger, because it means you can understand and support each other better.
text:
💛 Kompartí bo emoshonnan ta duna un ehèmpel importante pa bo tiner - mas ainda na ora di kompartí emoshonnan difísil! 

🌷 E ta hasi tur hende den famia mas fuerte, pasobra e ta nifiká ku bo por komprondé i sostené otro mihó.

SourceText:
💛 It’s okay not to want to share when your feelings are strong.

🌱 When you feel calmer, find time to explain so that everyone can understand.
text:
💛 Ta oké pa no ke kompartí ora bo sintimentunan ta fuerte.

🌱 Ora bo ta sinti bo mas trankil, buska tempu pa splika ya asina tur hende por komprondé.

SourceText: Children need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient. Try again. Remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction.
text: Mucha mester di tempu pa siña sigui instrukshon. Tene pasenshi. Purba atrobe. Kòrda elogiá nan kada bes ku nan sigui un instrukshon.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our children. Next time you spend one-on-one time with your child, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”
text: Tin bia por ta difísil pa kòrda pa elogiá nos yunan. E siguiente biaha ku bo pasa tempu huntu abo ku bo yu, purba i pensa riba un kos ku bo por elogi'é p’e. Bo por asta bisa: “Danki pa pasa tempu ku mi!”

SourceText: It’s difficult to give instructions in a calm way when we are still angry. Try to find a time when you are calm or to use a calming strategy like Take a Pause before you introduce a positive instruction.
text: Ta difísil pa duna instrukshon na un manera trankil ora nos ta rabiá ainda. Purba di haña un momentu ku bo ta trankil òf usa un strategia di pa kalma bo mes manera Tuma un Pousa promé ku bo introdusí un instrukshon positivo.

SourceText: This is difficult to remember for everyone at first! Try to take a breath before giving an instruction. Also, remember to be gentle with yourself when you forget. It happens to everyone!
text: Esaki ta difísil pa kòrda pa tur hende na promé instante! Purba di hala rosea promé ku duna un instrukshon. Tambe, kòrda pa ta amabel ku bo mes ora bo lubidá. E ta pasa ku tur hende!

SourceText: Make sure to have a rule that can be kept easily. For example, try having one meal together every week instead of every night.
text: Sòru pa tin un regla ku ta fásil pa mantené. Por ehèmpel, purba di kome un kuminda huntu tur siman en bes di tur anochi.

SourceText:
📖 When creating rules, it is important to think about the age & ability of each teen so you can come up with realistic routines for Your Teen.

⏰ This is most important for bedtime, the time to come home, and household chores.

💡 Try to agree on a small and meaningful incentive that can motivate Your Teen to follow the rule. Consider options like watching a movie or playing a video game. 

What other ideas come to mind?
text:
📖 Ora di krea reglanan, ta importante pa pensa riba e edat i abilidat di kada tiner ya bo por bini ku rutinanan realístiko pa Bo Tiner.

⏰ Esaki ta mas importante pa ora di drumi, e ora pa bin kas i tareanan di kas.

💡 Purba di bai di akuerdo riba un insentivo chikí i signifikante ku por motivá Bo Tiner pa sigui e regla. Konsiderá opshonnan manera wak un pelíkula òf hunga un wega di video. 

Ki otro ideanan ta bini na bo mente?

SourceText:
🌷 When we create rules together with our children, we build trust and an open relationship with them. 

🔑 The rules we set will be more realistic and your child will be more willing and able to follow the rules.

💡Think about the valuable lessons you’ll be teaching your child, such as working together and taking initiative. Try to start with an easy and small rule.
text:
🌷 Ora nos krea regla huntu ku nos yunan, nos ta konstrui konfiansa i un relashon habrí ku nan.

🔑 E reglanan ku nos ta pone lo ta mas realístiko i bo yu lo ta mas dispuesto i kapas pa sigui e reglanan.

💡Pensa riba e lèsnan balioso ku bo ta bai siña bo yu, manera traha huntu i tuma inisiativa. Purba kuminsá ku un regla fásil i chikí.

SourceText: Possible answers from parents:
text: Posibel kontesta di mayornan:

SourceText:
We can continue to stay in touch.
We can continue to chat weekly.
We can keep practicing the Building Blocks we have learnt.
We can learn what family and parenting services are available in our community.
text:
Nos por sigui keda den kontakto.
Nos por sigui 'chat' tur siman.
Nos por sigui praktiká e Komponentenan Básiko ku nos a siña.
Nos por siña kiko ta e servisionan di famia i di edukashon familiar ku ta disponibel den nos komunidat.

SourceText:
You may want to close your eyes and sit comfortably while you listen to this message.

Take a moment to think about what your lives and children were like before the programme began.

Now think about each of the parts of the ParentChat programme:

Spending One-on-One time with your child

Talking about feelings

Keeping it positive with praise and instructions

Involving your children in making household rules and daily routines

Using positive discipline like redirect and consequences

Involving your children in solving problems

Think about how the things you learned during the programme were different from the way you interacted with your children before the programme.

Think about how you have changed, how your relationship to your children has changed, and how your children’s behaviours have changed.

When you are ready, you can open your eyes.
text:
Lo bo ke sera bo wowonan i sinta kómodamente miéntras bo ta skucha e mensahe akí.

Tuma un ratu pa pensa kon boso bida i yunan tabata promé ku e programa a kuminsá.

Awor pensa riba kada un di e partinan di e programa di Mayor Konektá:

Pasando Tempu abo ku bo yu

Papia tokante sintimentunan

Mantené esaki positivo ku elogio i instrukshonnan

Enbolbí bo yunan den traha reglanan di kas i rutinanan diario

Usando disiplina positivo manera kambia atenshon i konsekuensianan

Enbolbí bo yunan den solushoná problema

Pensa riba kon e kosnan ku bo a siña durante e programa tabata diferente for di e manera ku bo a interkambiá ku bo yunan promé ku e programa.

Pensa kon bo a kambia, kon bo relashon ku bo yunan a kambia, i kon komportashon di bo yunan a kambia.

Ora bo ta kla, bo por habri bo wowonan.

SourceText:
**WELCOME (15 minutes)**
- Begin by welcoming the participants.
- Do a Name Game to help everyone get to know each other.
- Remind the group of the programme structure and content.
- Lead a short physical exercise to energize the group.
- Review the ground rules for the session.

**OVERVIEW (30 minutes)**
- Reminder of programme structure and content 
- Ground rules 
- Parent goals

**BREAK (15 min)**

**CORE LESSON: Parenting Skill – One-on-One Time (50 minutes)**
- Video Story 1 and role-play the scenario together as a big group.
- Video Story 2 and do another big group role-play.
- Discuss the benefits of spending One-on-One Time with your child.
- Brainstorm activities caregivers can do with their children during One-on-One Time.
- Practice One-on-One Time in pairs.
- Review tips for making One-on-One Time effective and enjoyable.


**HOME ACTIVITIES & CLOSING (10 minutes)**
Caregivers are encouraged to:
- Have a conversation with their child about the goals identified in the session.
- Spend at least 5 minutes each day in One-on-One Time with their child.
- Take a Pause whenever feeling stressed or upset.
- Do the Physical Exercise every morning after waking up.
For closing: 
- Review the core topics covered in the session.
- Inform caregivers about the text messages they will receive.
- Remind them about the next online session and the home activities.
- Thank and praise all participants for their contributions.
text:
**BONBINÍ (15 minüt)**
- Kuminsá dor di yama e partisipantenan bon biní.
- Hasi un Wega di Nomber pa yuda tur hende siña konosé otro.
- Kòrda e grupo riba e struktura i kontenido di e programa.
- Guia un ehersisio físiko kòrtiku pa aktivá e grupo.
- Repasá e reglanan básiko pa e seshon.

**BISTA GENERAL (30 minüt)**
- Rekordatorio di struktura i kontenido di programa 
- Reglanan básiko 
- Metanan di mayor

**POUSA (15 min)**

LÈS NUKLEO: Abilidat di Edukashon Familiar - Tempu pa abo ku bo yu (50 minüt)**
- Kuenta riba Video 1 i 'rollenspel' huntu komo un grupo grandi.
- Kuenta riba Video 2 i hasi un otro 'rollenspel' di grupo grandi.
- Diskutí e benefisionan di pasa Tempu pa abo ku bo yu.
- Pensa ideanan pa aktividatnan ku dunadónan di kuido por hasi ku nan yunan durante Tempu ku nan yu.
- Praktiká Tempu pa abo ku bo yu den pareha.
- Repasá tepnan pa hasi Tempu pa abo ku bo yu efektivo i agradabel.


**AKTIVIDATNAN DI KAS & KLOUSURA (10 minüt)**
Enkurashá dunadónan di kuido pa:
- Tene un kombersashon ku nan yu tokante e metanan identifiká den e seshon.
- Pasa por lo ménos 5 minüt tur dia di Tempu huntu ku nan yu.
- Tuma un Pousa ora bo ta sinti bo mes di strès òf alterá.
- Hasi e Ehersisio Físiko tur mainta despues di lanta.
Pa klousurá: 
- Repasá e tópikonan prinsipal ku boso a kubri den e seshon.
- Informá dunadónan di kuido tokante e mensahenan di teksto ku nan lo risibí.
- Kòrda nan tokante e siguiente seshon ònlain i e aktividatnan di kas.
- Gradisí i elogiá tur partisipante pa nan aporte.

SourceText:
**Which of the parents in your group participated?**
*Participation is defined as any parent who posts a comment, question, reply or reaction (such as a thumbs up) within the chat since you shared the first message from the weekly discussion.*
text:
**Kua di e mayornan den bo grupo a partisipá?**
*Ta definí partisipashon komo kualke mayor ku ta pone un komentario, pregunta, kontesta òf reakshon (manera un duim ariba) den e kòmbersashon desde ku bo a kompartí e promé mensahe di e diskushon semanal.*
